title: Theodor Liebisch
text:
Theodor Liebisch (29 April 1852, <a href="Breslau">Breslau</a> – 9 February 1922, <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>) was a German <a href="mineralogist">mineralogist</a> and <a href="crystallography">crystallographer</a>.
Biography.
In 1874 he received his doctorate from the <a href="University%20of%20Breslau">University of Breslau</a>, then worked as an assistant to <a href="Gerhard%20vom%20Rath">Gerhard vom Rath</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Bonn">University of Bonn</a>. After several years spent as a curator at the mineralogical museum of the <a href="University%20of%20Berlin">University of Berlin</a>, he became an associate professor of mineralogy at Breslau (1880). Afterwards he successively served as a full professor of mineralogy at the universities of <a href="University%20of%20Greifswald">Greifswald</a> (1883/84), <a href="University%20of%20K%C3%B6nigsberg">Königsberg</a> (from 1884), <a href="University%20of%20G%C3%B6ttingen">Göttingen</a> (1887–1909) and Berlin (1909–22). He was an editor of the periodical "Jahrbuch für Mineralogie, Geologie und Paläontologie".
His name is associated with "Liebisch twinning", a complex type of <a href="crystal%20twinning">crystal twinning</a> that is a combination of the Dauphiné and Brazil twinning laws.
